channel.title: dessert – Chow Down Orlando
channel.description: Exploring all that Orlando has to offer.

item.title: All Things Sweet
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the chocolate peanut butter cupcake from the All Things Sweet Truck. This truck is part of the culinary program at the Orlando Union Rescue Mission where they are teaching culinary skills to people in transition. The proceeds from the cupcake sales help to fund the program. The cupcakes are well worth the price […]

The post All Things Sweet appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the chocolate peanut butter cupcake from the All Things Sweet Truck. This truck is part of the culinary program at the Orlando Union Rescue Mission where they are teaching culinary skills to people in transition. The proceeds from the cupcake sales help to fund the program.

The cupcakes are well worth the price of $4. First of all, they’re huge. Second, they’re delicious. They hold up to the other great cupcake trucks in town.

You can find All Things Sweet at their website.

The post All Things Sweet appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Cafe Rouge Express
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Cafe Rouge is a favorite on this blog and it isn’t just for their great meals, they have awesome desserts as well. This is the beer-battered and deep fried New York cheesecake covered in cinnamon and powdered sugar. And yes, it was every bit as amazing as it looks. You can find Cafe Rouge on […]

The post Cafe Rouge Express appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Cafe Rouge is a favorite on this blog and it isn’t just for their great meals, they have awesome desserts as well. This is the beer-battered and deep fried New York cheesecake covered in cinnamon and powdered sugar.

And yes, it was every bit as amazing as it looks.

You can find Cafe Rouge on Twitter.

The post Cafe Rouge Express appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Yalaha Bakery
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is a white chocolate, cranberry, and walnut cookie from the Yalaha Bakery. It is every bit as delicious as it appears. Not pictured, because I was too eager to start eating, was a chocolate peanut butter ball that was extremely rich and delicious. Stop by. You’ll be glad you did.

The post Yalaha Bakery appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is a white chocolate, cranberry, and walnut cookie from the Yalaha Bakery. It is every bit as delicious as it appears.

Not pictured, because I was too eager to start eating, was a chocolate peanut butter ball that was extremely rich and delicious.

Stop by. You’ll be glad you did.

The post Yalaha Bakery appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Stay Clam Cupcakes
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Look out Yum Yum, there’s another cupcake truck in town! Stay Calm Cupcakes is a new truck providing quality cupcakes from their truck window. Pictured here is the banana split, which was a banana flavored cake filled with a strawberry cream and topped with chocolate icing and a cherry. It was very good. Carla was […]

The post Stay Clam Cupcakes appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Look out Yum Yum, there’s another cupcake truck in town!

Stay Calm Cupcakes is a new truck providing quality cupcakes from their truck window. Pictured here is the banana split, which was a banana flavored cake filled with a strawberry cream and topped with chocolate icing and a cherry. It was very good.

Carla was a fan of the pumpkin spice cupcake and I also enjoyed the Boston creme.

If you see Stay Calm on the road, do what the say: “stay calm and have a cupcake!”

You can find Stay Calm Cupcakes on Twitter.

The post Stay Clam Cupcakes appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Pop Craft
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is a popsicle from Pop Craft, a dessert cart here in Orlando. It is homemade and vegan friendly. What you see inside is a mixture of french pear, thyme, and tarragon and it’s freaking delicious. Pop Craft popsicles are made here locally and the amazing flavor combinations are conjured by a professional sommelier, which […]

The post Pop Craft appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is a popsicle from Pop Craft, a dessert cart here in Orlando. It is homemade and vegan friendly. What you see inside is a mixture of french pear, thyme, and tarragon and it’s freaking delicious.

Pop Craft popsicles are made here locally and the amazing flavor combinations are conjured by a professional sommelier, which explains why some of the stranger sounding combinations are so good. On this particular day I also tried the Mexican Chocolate, which had a nice bite of cinnamon.

You can find Pop Craft on Twitter.

The post Pop Craft appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Dimples Delights
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the Summer Cake – lemon cake with raspberry filling dipped in white chocolate – from the Dimples Delights food truck and it’s wonderful! Dimples Delights is a new dessert truck here in Orlando that opened it’s window for the first time yesterday. Six of these two-bite masterpieces were $5, a steal if you […]

The post Dimples Delights appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the Summer Cake – lemon cake with raspberry filling dipped in white chocolate – from the Dimples Delights food truck and it’s wonderful!

Dimples Delights is a new dessert truck here in Orlando that opened it’s window for the first time yesterday. Six of these two-bite masterpieces were $5, a steal if you ask me, and offered a few other delicious sounding morsels: banana cake dipped in milk chocolate, her grandmother’s recipe kuchen bread, turnovers, and more.

You can find Dimpels Delights on Twitter and Facebook and be sure you do, they’re one to look for.

The post Dimples Delights appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Fork in the Road
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
When I first came upon Fork in the Road, I was almost overwhelmed with the extent of their menu. There were so many options that sounded great, it was hard to decide what to eat. There was pulled pork to macaroni and cheese pops to beef tongue. I ended up selecting the 72-hour marinated pork belly […]

The post Fork in the Road appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
When I first came upon Fork in the Road, I was almost overwhelmed with the extent of their menu. There were so many options that sounded great, it was hard to decide what to eat. There was pulled pork to macaroni and cheese pops to beef tongue. I ended up selecting the 72-hour marinated pork belly bánh mi sandwich.

The sandwich was good, not fantastic, but good. The bread, which is the same for all of their sandwiches, was a little too hard and thick for my taste and took away from pork belly and slaw inside. It also was relatively overpriced for what was presented.

On the other hand, the menu didn’t stop at sandwiches. There were almost an equal number of amazing sounding desserts that ranged from homemade whoopee pies to Elvis inspired cookie and ice cream sandwiches to what is pictured above: the peanut butter cup on steroids.

Like the sandwich, the dessert price is high, however here it was worth every single penny. When it comes from the truck, all that can be seen above the foil container is a layer of chocolate and a small Reese’s cup. But upon digging in, there’s layer after layer of goodness. At the base of the cup is a thick chocolate cookie with a layer of solid chocolate. Above that is a thick layer of very smooth peanut butter which is followed by a chocolate mouse and the chocolate topping that’s visible at the beginning. Every bite of this thing is so good.

If you see Fork in the Road then my advice is to skip the sandwiches and go straight for the dessert.

Fork in the Road can be found on Facebook.

The post Fork in the Road appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Yum Yum Cupcakes
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Seriously, can you go wrong with The Yum Yum Cupcake Truck? I mean, we’ve talked about them before, and every time we go it’s delicious. Pictured here is the dark chocolate raspberry cupcake. And yes, it was as good as it looks. You can find, and you should, Yum Yum on Twitter.

The post Yum Yum Cupcakes appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Seriously, can you go wrong with The Yum Yum Cupcake Truck? I mean, we’ve talked about them before, and every time we go it’s delicious. Pictured here is the dark chocolate raspberry cupcake. And yes, it was as good as it looks.

You can find, and you should, Yum Yum on Twitter.

The post Yum Yum Cupcakes appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Batter Bowl
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
This is the oatmeal cream pie from the Batter Bowl Truck. It is as delicious as it looks. It’s a true, childhood treat. Follow the Batter Bowl on Twitter.

The post Batter Bowl appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
This is the oatmeal cream pie from the Batter Bowl Truck. It is as delicious as it looks. It’s a true, childhood treat.

item.title: Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles serves up some amazing chicken and waffles, as Carla has mentioned before, but this time it’s all about dessert. Her waffles are nice and thick and when it’s covered with whipped cream, marshmallow fluff, and Nutella, what could possibly go wrong? I mean, seriously, just look at it and tell me […]

The post Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles serves up some amazing chicken and waffles, as Carla has mentioned before, but this time it’s all about dessert. Her waffles are nice and thick and when it’s covered with whipped cream, marshmallow fluff, and Nutella, what could possibly go wrong? I mean, seriously, just look at it and tell me that’s not amazing.

You can find Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles on Twitter.

The post Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
